11  public class CollectionAdaptor<T> : IReorderableListAdaptor {
15  private Func<T, float> _height;

20  private ReorderableListControl.ItemDrawer<T> _drawer;

25  private ICollection<T> _collection;

30  private T[] _collectionCache;
31 
38  public void InvalidateCache() {
39  _collectionCache = _collection.ToArray();
40  }
41 
42  public CollectionAdaptor(ICollection<T> collection,
43  ReorderableListControl.ItemDrawer<T> drawer, Func<T, float> height) {
44 
45  _collection = collection;
46  _drawer = drawer ?? ReorderableListGUI.DefaultItemDrawer;
47  _height = height;
48 
49  InvalidateCache();
50  }
51 
52  public int Count {
53  get { return _collectionCache.Length; }
54  }
55

57  return true;
58  }
59 
60  public virtual bool CanRemove(int index) {
61  return true;
62  }
63 
64  public void Add() {
65  T item = default(T);
66  _collection.Add(item);
67 
68  InvalidateCache();
69  }
70 
71  public void Insert(int index) {
72  throw new NotSupportedException();
73  }
74 
75  public void Duplicate(int index) {
76  T element = _collection.ElementAt(index);
77 
78  _collection.Add(element);
79  InvalidateCache();
80  }
81 
82  public void Remove(int index) {
83  T element = _collection.ElementAt(index);
84 
85  _collection.Remove(element);
86  InvalidateCache();
87  }
88 
89  public void Move(int sourceIndex, int destIndex) {
90  throw new NotSupportedException();
91  }
92 
93  public void Clear() {
94  _collection.Clear();
95  InvalidateCache();
96  }
97 
98  public virtual void DrawItem(Rect position, int index) {
99  T element = _collectionCache[index];
100  T updated = _drawer(position, element);
101 
102  // If the modified item is equal to the updated item, then we don't have to replace it
103  // in the collection.
104  if (EqualityComparer<T>.Default.Equals(element, updated) == false) {
105  _collection.Remove(element);
106  _collection.Add(updated);
107  InvalidateCache();
108  }
109  }
110 
111  public virtual float GetItemHeight(int index) {
112  T element = _collectionCache[index];
113 
114  return _height(element);
115  }
116  }
117 }

FullInspector.Modules.Collections.CollectionAdaptor< T >.InvalidateCache
void InvalidateCache()
For performance reasons, the CollectionAdaptor stores an array version of the collection. If the adapted collection has been structurally modified, for example, an item has been added, then the local cache is invalid. Calling this method updates the cache, which will restore proper adapter semantics.
Definition: CollectionAdaptor.cs:38
